title: Sr. BlockChain Protocol Engineer - Kaleido
text:
• Strong back-end development experience using one of GO, Rust or Java
• Hands on experience in basic cryptography such as digital signature, encryption based on asymmetric or symmetric keys, key agreement
• Being able to explain consensus algorithms like Raft or Paxos, PBFT
• Excellent communicator who works well in extremely fast-paced team environments
• Thrives in chaos and is comfortable with the uncertainty and the rapid change of R&D projects
• Self-starter who can define and execute tasks with minimal guidance
• Knowledge in advanced cryptography a big plus such as group signature, zero knowledge proofs

Kaleido is a rapidly growing start-up aiming to make blockchain radically simple for organizations to adopt so that our societies will fully benefit from decentralized models and technologies. Kaleido, A ConsenSys Business, has partnered with Amazon Web Services to offer it's Blockchain Business Cloud -- the first all-in-one SaaS platform built for Enterprise Blockchain. It dramatically accelerates and simplifies private blockchain network creation and operation with click-button simplicity saving organizations months and millions in the process.Kaleido is set apart by its collaborative culture focused on putting people first and that's manifested in how we interact with each other, how we build products and solutions, and how we deliver them to our customers.We move fast, put real product in customers' hands, and iterate and learn as we move towards scale. This will allow you to make an immediate, high impact within a dedicated, and nimble team.Blockchain is a rapidly developing technology and we're excited to be one of the first pioneers in the field. Our team comes with deep technical experience and a dedication to our mission, but we still like to have fun and take full advantage of our startup environment by playing ping pong and foosball during breaks, enjoying a beer from the tap after work, team outings and more. Our team, based in urban startup hub Raleigh, NC., is continually growing and looking for more like-minded individuals. Find out more at https://kaleido.io ( https://kaleido.io )Kaleido is incubated by ConsenSys, a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. ConsenSys was started by co-founder of Ethereum Joseph Lubin, with over 50 projects and 1,000+ members around the world. The ConsenSys mission is to use the decentralized solutions from its projects to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.We're looking for a Sr. Blockchain Protocol Engineer - to join our agile development team focused on the deep blockchain layer. As active participants in the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance (EEA) and contributors to multiple open source projects (Quorum, Hyperledger Fabric), our protocol team is at the forefront of Enterprise adoption of blockchain technology. In addition to solving the challenge of running and scaling permissioned blockchain networks in mission-critical Enterprise use cases, this role is also working with open source communities around data privacy, cross-chain interoperability, using technique such as zero knowledge proofs and state channels. Blockchain is a rapidly evolving technology area that has attracted a lot of brilliant minds around the world both in academia and industry. This role will be on the bleeding edge of this exciting movement.A successful candidate will have opportunities to research and develop innovative approaches to some of the most challenging problems in software such as advanced cryptography and distributed systems.NICE TO HAVEKaleido is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and deeply values diversity. We strive to create an inclusive environment for the diverse cultures, perspectives, and experiences in our workforce.

Come join the Amazon Managed Blockchain team!Invent 2018, Amazon Managed Blockchain is a fully managed service that makes it easy for customers to create and managed scalable blockchain networks using the popular open source frameworks Hyperledger Fabric and Ethereum. The Amazon Managed Blockchain team is looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer who is passionate about building new products from the ground up and has an entrepreneurial approach to building new services for customers. The ideal candidate for this position has a proven track record of delivering outstanding products at scale and is passionate blockchain, distributed systems, containers, cryptography, distributed ledgers, and cloud scale software. You would be a core part of defining the technical direction and culture of this new team. This is a great opportunity for you to interact directly with customers and influence definition and design from scratch.https://aws.amazon.com/managed-blockchain/We are building new AWS services and features from the ground up, offering a unique opportunity for engineers who want to help define, design, build, and operate cloud services that are changing the world and enabling our customers. Additionally, you will get to collaborate with some of the best and brightest minds in the industry and join a fast-paced and growing team in one of the most innovative technology companies. Come join us to Work Hard, Have Fun, and Make History!

summary: Cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum). Are you a passionate FinTech Professional with a knack for changing lives?...
title: Part-Time Curriculum Engineer (FinTech)
text:
• Someone with at least 3-5+ years of industry experience in the financial technology sector. We're ideally looking for someone who has worked both in large organizations environments and in smaller startups.
• Someone with a lot of hands-on experience. We're building a program in which students learn by doing! At a minimum, you should have a strong familiarity with tools like:
• Someone who absolutely loves teaching and sharing knowledge with others. It's ideal if you've taught financial technology or programming in the past. Major plus if you've spoken at fintech conferences.
• Someone with a creative itch! This program will require a great deal of ingenuity and setup to create at scale. We want someone who is excited by the idea of creating KYC applications in blockchain or machine learning powered trading algorithms.
• Someone who is a lot of fun! We want learning technology to be exciting, engaging, and a little funny. Imagine an engineering class that feels like a Disney movie. We need fun people to make this a reality.
• Someone who can manage a team. We've got a team of brilliant curriculum developers who can build amazing modules. We want someone who can bring expertise and new vision to the program. We're looking for a true tech titan.
• Someone who isn't afraid to get their hands dirty. In this capacity, you'll be responsible for keeping a living curriculum up-to-date for hundreds of Instructors and TAs across the country. This means managing issues, pull requests, and bug fixes. It also means taking in community input on technology trends. We need someone with a bit of thick skin, an infectious enthusiasm for continual improvement, and an ability to maintain a community of professionals.
• Someone who is looking for more than just a paycheck. We can't stress this enough. Deep within all of us at Trilogy is the belief that our programs change lives. Each month we hear from countless students attesting to how our program brought them new skills, landed them new jobs, and a renewed sense of confidence. This impact is what our work is really about to us.
• You will be responsible for dreaming up and creating instructional activities for demonstrating key concepts in the area of financial technology -- on a part-time basis.
• You will be responsible for improving portions of our curriculum based on student learning data -- and continually asked to create improved content for teaching topics covered in our program.
• You will be responsible for staying abreast of technology trends and incorporate these trends into the curriculum.
• Lastly and most importantly, you will be responsible for making sure our program is the very best financial technology training program it can be. We want the person in this role to feel accountable to our students' success in the same way we hold ourselves accountable to their success in all other areas.

Are you a passionate FinTech Professional with a knack for changing lives? Do you love writing, teaching, and storytelling as much as you love writing Python code? Are you a Blockchain wizard who loves discussing the latest trends in the field? Then we may have the position for you.At Trilogy Education Services, we're creating programs to train new audiences for careers in the tech industry. Our programs are taught at the leading universities across the country including the University of Pennsylvania, University of California Berkeley, Northwestern, UNC Chapel Hill, Rutgers, UT Austin, and many others. We pride ourselves on building high-quality programs that help ambitious, hardworking adults change their lives through practical skills, fundamental knowledge, and the confidence to advance their careers.We're looking for a top-notch FinTech professional with a love for teaching, inspiring, and helping newcomers enter the field of financial technology. The program we're developing combines theoretical teaching with plenty of hands-on practical, skills-based training.Trilogy Education Services ( http://www.trilogyed.com/ ) is a Workforce Accelerator whose mission is to empower universities to transform the lives of students by preparing them for high-growth careers in the Digital Economy. We create and manage skills-based training programs that are university-run, student-tested, and employer-approved. Each Trilogy program is individually designed to meet the needs of regional employers, and to ensure that students graduate with both technical skills and personal confidence to succeed in their careers. The world's leading universities, including Northwestern School of Professional Studies, UC Berkeley Extension, and Rutgers Division of Continuing Studies, trust Trilogy to help their students meet the needs of the Digital Economy.We're a rapidly growing and established education company with thousands of students enrolled in our programs. We're data-driven -- with a startup like culture and tremendous opportunities to have a huge impact.Oh. And we're a ridiculously fun place to work.

title: Software Engineer, Security
text:
• Performing vulnerability assessments and code reviews/audits as well as developing tools to enhance & automate our security systems/processes and procedures
• Assessing application risks and partnering with development teams to recommend mitigation strategies
• Responding to security incidents and developing operations to detect potential incidents
• Develop technical solutions to help mitigate security vulnerabilities by helping build upon our existing automation
• Manages cyber security compliance activities and drives improvements where needed including bug bounty programs and 3rd-party consulting engagement
• Conduct internal/external penetration testing and direct remediation efforts across all applications and products
• Promote awareness of security issues among management and ensure sound security principles are reflected in the organization's vision and goals
• Evaluate, recommend and integrate new security technology and tools by conducting feasibility studies and proof of concepts
• Familiarity with modern programming languages including Rust, Golang, Scala, Haskell, Erlang, Clojure, C, C++ or Python
• Certification in highly technical application security or application security disciplines such as: CSSLP, CASS, GWEB, GWAPT, GPEN, CEH, CISSP
• Understanding of the full Software Development Lifecycle & expert understanding of web application technologies
• Experience protecting against and mitigating real world attacks (DDoS, XSS, session-hijacking, SQL injection, CSRF, etc.)
• Well-versed in security protocols as well as in software security techniques
• Demonstrated experience with data security and physical security needs in a mission critical environment
• Understanding of enterprise computing environments, distributed applications, and a strong understanding of TCP/IP networks
• Packet capturing and network sniffing and monitoring with SNORT/Wireshark/Tcpdump
• Perform and mitigate NoSQL and SQL injections for a variety of databases
• General and functional knowledge of hardware and software products that enhance the security of systems such as Intrusion Prevention Systems (host and network-based), Firewalls, Security Event Management Systems, port scanning and vulnerability identification, monitoring and logging mechanisms, etc.
• Must possess basic knowledge of network, desktop and distributed server hardware and software
• Experience in documenting and maintaining processes and procedures
• Comfortable working on both Linux-based and MS Windows-based system platforms with a strong IT technical understanding and aptitude for analytical problem-solving.
• Company sponsored medical, dental and vision benefits, as well as a choice of providers

SECURITY ENGINEERWe’re building cutting-edge solutions using the latest technological achievements at the intersection of blockchain, cryptography, distributed computing and network protocols. We’re looking for talented engineers, who can design elegant software architectures and execute on them with high degree of craftsmanship.You will design, develop and support the Chronicled Network. You will be working with our CTO, product managers and engineering team to deliver mission-critical enterprise software that powers entire industries. Our team is constantly growing and evolving, so you will have plenty of opportunities to shape, develop and enhance it as a key contributor.ResponsibilitiesSkills and QualificationsTECHNICAL CAPABILITIESPerksSend resume and cover letter to careers@chronicled.com [jobs@chronicled.com]

title: 2017-016 Blockchain Developer
text:
DESE Research, Inc. is looking for an experienced Blockchain Developer to focus on developing Blockchain technologies for advanced cybersecurity research applicable to the US Department of Defense. This position will be responsible for both research and development of a blockchain based prototype application for data protection.

 

 This position will join a team of researchers solving challenging science and technology problems faced by the DoD in cyber security and supply chain security. These are major growth areas for DESE and we are looking for candidates who want to contribute significant research within these promising areas.

 

 Education: Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science or similar field.
• 5+ Years of professional experience in software development and object-oriented design methodologies
• Experience with C/C++, Java, Go, Python, JavaScript, Angular, Node, or JSON
• Technical understanding of Ethereum, Bitcoin, and other Blockchain technologies
• Strong ability to grasp new knowledge and skills through independent research and study
• Applicants will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet DoD requirements for a security clearance.

title: Electronic Discovery & Litigation Support Analyst
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

Gemini is seeking an Electronic Discovery (eDiscovery) and Litigation Support Subject Matter Expert (SME) to provide project management, guidance and technical expertise for an Enterprise eDiscovery practice and response. This individual will be working alongside internal and external investigators, internal and external counsel, and other entities to ensure compliance with and efficient responses to electronic discovery matters.
• Assist with the execution of an eDiscovery System program (investigators, management, attorneys, paralegals, project managers, etc.)
• Perform complex collections and searches, create workspaces and templates, designs workflows appropriate for data sets, and provides consultative support on best practices
• Coordinate documentation development as deliverables, such as Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), User Guidance.
• Develop eDiscovery workflows for the finding and collection of requested material
• Coordinate reviews and assist with analysis and processing as directed by counsel.
• Ensure the accuracy of data collected, manipulation, and conversion by performing and documenting quality checks.
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in the eDiscovery or forensics field
• Five (5) years of hands-on Electronic Discovery experience in the litigation support technology field
• Ability to work independently and excel in a high tempo operational environment
• Ability to define and analyze problems, and develop solutions

It Pays to Work Here

We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes:
• Ownership in the company via profit sharing units 



Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

This team manages all inbound service requests, communications with customers while onboarding, and is increasingly contributing to outbound communications. The Customer Support teams main focus is our Retail customers, but increasingly they are interacting with Institutional Customers. During periods of low-service volume, the team also takes on support-centric projects.

Gemini is looking for a self-motivated, personable, hands-on individual who is experienced and eager to lead the Customer Support team. As the leader of our Customer Support Team, you’ll directly manage a team associates in NYC, as well as lead a remote support team. You’ll be responsible for ensuring the quality of our service remains best-in-class, maximizing efficiency, developing relationships with other departments to ensure our customers’ needs are being met, and continuing to build upon the team’s rapidly evolving infrastructure.

• Excellent listening and communication skills, coupled with strong interpersonal and relationship management skills
• Ability to motivate others to do complicated tasks and fulfill their potential

title: Legal Assistant
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

The Legal department at Gemini is making history, paving the way when it comes to applying the legacy of law to the future of digital assets. On this team, we tackle complex and unprecedented applications of the current legal system to the revolutionary industry of cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. At Gemini, Legal plays a critical role in guiding innovation and driving value for the business, while upholding our core tenets of security, compliance, and trust for our customers. Join us and help define the Legal Department of the Future.

An excellent legal assistant is the backbone of a successful Legal Department. In this role, you will roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, and conduct legal research in the unchartered territory of digital assets, cryptocurrency, and blockchain technology. Working alongside the General Counsel and the rest of the Legal team, you will partner closely with key internal stakeholders across Engineering, Product, Compliance, Finance, Business Development, and Operations as we work to solve novel legal challenges in this groundbreaking territory.
• Provide exceptional, responsive, and meticulous support to a wide variety of projects undertaken by the Legal team.
• Successfully liaise with Leadership across all of Gemini’s internal departments, ensuring the employment of legal considerations when helping to solve problems and handling inbound requests.
• Research and deliver findings in the fintech and crypto industries that will help drive innovation for implementing legal policies across regions.
• Handle corporate governance matters and manage processes, policies, and formalities associated with Gemini’s status as a regulated trust company.
• Proactively manage tasks, including drafting agreements, processing and negotiating NDAs, data entry, organizing legal documents, and responding to subpoenas for employment legal records - all done in a timely and highly organized manner.
• Aid in the building of a nimble, impactful Legal function at Gemini
• Authorization to work in the United States and fluency in English.
• Ability to manage and prioritize numerous projects simultaneously in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
• Flexibility and willingness to work on a broad range of legal matters.
• Demonstrated interest in disruptive technology and desire to learn.

The Gemini Security team forms the backbone of all that we do and is as diverse as the number of challenges we tackle in the crypto space. From security architecture and engineering to maintenance of cold storage systems and data centers to cybersecurity and litigation support, our team ensures that our customers, clients, and employees are safe, secure, and supported.

Gemini is looking for an Information Security Operations Analyst to join our growing information security operations team. In this role, you will report directly to the Security Operations Lead and we be part of a team responsible for monitoring, operations, investigations and response to events within the Gemini environment.
• Analyze data feeds for event detection, and perform correlation analysis on data from multiple monitoring sources.
• Analyze data, perform research, and verify information for potential misconduct or abnormal behavior.

• Utilize data mining tools to collect, search, sort, and organize large amounts of information.

• Produce reports, summaries, and other forms of communication that may be both internal and client facing, to include leadership and executive management.
• Draft root cause analysis reports and recommendations after cybersecurity incidents.
• Stay current with Security technologies and make recommendations for use based on business value
• Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to interact effectively with executives, engineers, vendors and peers.
• Team player required. Must be able to interact with peers, management, and senior engineers in a constantly evolving environment to ensure a positive team experience and atmosphere in the workplace.
• Understanding of IT operations: help desk, endpoint management and server management

text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

As a Quality Assurance engineer at Gemini, you'll work together with a team of engineers, using your programming skills to design and develop detailed and robust test automation. You'll engage in functional and performance testing with an agile methodology in mind, and in proactive strategy and investigation to test the integrity of our products and product features. The ideal candidate loves to code and loves to immerse themselves in solving challenging problems. This position is full-time at Gemini’s offices in New York City or in Portland, and will report to the Head of Quality Assurance.
• Test new products, product features, and bug fixes in the functional areas of a financial exchange such as:
• Write automated and manual tests necessary to ensure the operation and correctness of new product features as well as overall system behavior (i.e., regression testing).
• Execute various phases of functional and nonfunctional testing to certify the quality of new software releases.
• Provide input as required to the planning, requirements definition, and design process for new products and product features, with an eye toward testability.
• Review other test engineers’ code and test plans for completeness, correctness, style, etc.
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or alternative related field (or commensurate work experience)
• 1+ years experience working in an enterprise-scale programming language (e.g., Java, C#, Scala, etc.)
• 2 years experience with functional and performance testing in large-scale, complex, full-stack systems
• 1+ years experience working with financial technology, such as exchanges or trading firms

title: Junior Technical Recruiter
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

The People Team at Gemini is more than HR — we are thought partners, business influencers, and ambassadors for our company culture. Our tight-knit team is comprised of recruiters, program managers, and human resources specialists, and our job is a big one: create best-in-class processes and programs that find, grow, and retain amazing talent at Gemini. You’ll be on the ground floor of a quickly growing organization.

This role will be instrumental in supporting the rapid scaling of Gemini’s Technology capability, and will grant the individual broad exposure to the many sub-departments within Technology. The junior technical recruiter will hone in on sourcing across different mediums, establish proactive communication chains with promising candidates, and assist the team in creating and implementing strategies to identify top talent for many of our technical roles. This position is full-time at Gemini’s offices in New York City, and will report to the Lead Technical Recruiter.
• Source and assist in recruiting a diverse slate of active and passive candidates across multiple technical openings: Software Engineering, Data Engineering, Front End, Mobile, Infrastructure, and more as needs arise
• Create and foster high touch relationships with active and passive candidates
• Report on sourcing channel measures of success and interpret the data to suggest the viability of sourcing strategies and improvements as needed
• Analyze recruiting metrics to identify areas of improvement and provide data-driven recommendations to team members and key stakeholders
• Strategize on new and inventive ways to build candidate pipelines and execute on tactical research, referral generation, events and sourcing campaigns to achieve hiring goals
• Partner with leadership to understand the competitive landscape and gather insightful recruiting data
• 1+ years of technical recruiting and/or sourcing experience, preferably in a high-growth technology or startup environment
• An understanding of engineering functions across industries and the ability to assess a candidate's technical skills
• Proven ability to proactively engage candidates and manage them through the interview process
• The capacity to act swiftly under pressure and adapt to changing priorities and processes
• Design, experiment and test new approaches to attracting diverse candidates to our open roles
• Proven track record for successfully identifying and hiring exceptional candidates in high growth environments
• Solid tech and industry knowledge with ability to understand relevant tech skills, target companies, conferences, open source communities
• Experience in a high growth startup environment, preferably in the financial services or blockchain/crypto industries
• Experience in leveraging creative sourcing techniques through multiple channels (web, social/professional networks, etc.)
• Proactively identify and assess talent using a variety of sourcing methodologies including but not limited to LinkedIn, Boolean searches, networking, complex web searches, environmental scanning and research 



IT PAYS TO WORK HERE

We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes:
• Ownership in the company via profit sharing units

Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. title: Visual Designer, Product
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

In Design Tech, we think comfort zones are the enemy of creativity. A dynamic team of designers, engineers, researchers, our team blends beauty with tech to create a world-class product interface for our exchange. We are inspired by design, fueled by data, and obsessed with the user, both retail and institution

Join a dynamic and tight-knit team of UX designers, visual designers, and front end and mobile engineers to expand and codify Gemini’s digital identity. As a Product Designer, you live and breath the user experience; guided by data and business objectives, you will collaborate with developers to create an interface that not only delights the user, but educates them on the power of cryptocurrency. This is an incredibly exciting and unique opportunity to define the crypto user experience across all digital touchpoints and help us enable a value revolution through the power of digital assets.
• Evolve, explore and apply our visual identity; become fully immersed in the Gemini brand and mission
• Ability to synthesize complex, interdependent, and sometimes competing needs
• Ability to balance and prioritize multiple digital projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
• Generate clear ideas, concepts and designs of creative assets from beginning to end
• Collaborate with a cross-functional team that includes engineers, product managers in order to create elegant simple interfaces
• 3-4 years experience with demonstrated sensibilities in your body of work
• Have a portfolio that shows an eye for detail, understanding of typography, and aesthetic
• Must have experience in creating visual interface designs for websites and mobile applications
• Be a conceptual thinker and always explore multiple directions before landing on a solution
• Extensive experience with Sketch, Adobe CS (i.e. Photoshop and Illustrator), and the Google suite of apps
• Strong organizational, communication and conceptual thinking skills as well as attention to detail
• Team player and self-starter with a passion for design and finding smart solutions to complex problems
• Strong collaboration with all disciplines of design, product and engineering to bring the work to life
• A strong point of view with a healthy dose of humility
• Proven track record of validating design decisions through user feedback, quantitative insights, and business objectives.

• Ownership in the company via profit sharing units

title: Technology Operations Lead
text:
HELP US BUILD THE FUTURE OF MONEY

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

Our Infrastructure team is responsible for building and operating Gemini's world class crypto exchange systems and networks. The SREs are specifically responsible for building, automating, and scaling our growing server footprint and product offerings. Our infrastructure is a combination of high speed datacenter-based equipment and cloud hosted components.

This individual will be responsible for building a world class Tier 1 and Tier 2 technical operations team covering systems, networking, and applications. We are looking for a process oriented leader who has established rigorous operational models and processes (Operational runbooks, Change Management, Configuration Management, Incident Management, Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery) at other financially regulated institutions. The ideal candidate will have a process oriented mindset, strong leadership and team building skills, and a focus on innovative thinking. This role reports to the CIO in our offices in Manhattan.
• Build a highly-skilled team of technology professionals with the capabilities to not only manage applications/infrastructure but also build the tooling and monitoring necessary to effectively and efficiently monitor and manage our 24x7 environment.
• Ensure the successful preparation, deployment, monitoring, and reliable operation of Gemini’s infrastructure and applications across datacenters and AWS.
• Develop and maintain Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) of Gemini’s infrastructure and applications providing strategic visibility of the platforms capabilities.
• Manage, mentor, and lead staff, providing guidance, training and motivation as necessary to develop team members.
• Lead the development and operation of a rigorous incident management process
• Be a central point of responsibility as it relates to maintaining accountability to our change management processes.
• Cultivate expertise in the team's subject matter including its bare-mental & cloud architecture as well as any other supporting technology components
• Provide timely communications and response to key stakeholders, external clients, and regulators with respect to the operations of our exchange and infrastructure
• Identify opportunities for continuous improvement by leading quality initiatives to improve the delivery of service levels.
• Maintain responsibility for delivering hardware and software maintenance and ensuring uptime of critical technology for our clients.
• Experience in capital markets (e.g., exchange, market maker, latency-sensitive broker etc.) and/or regulated financial services industries
• Experience communicating with regulators (e.g. NYDFS, SEC, FINRA, CFTC, etc) about operational rigor
• Familiarity with infrastructure management and operations lifecycle concepts and ecosystem
• Strong attention to detail with ability to interact with stakeholders and key vendors reporting roadmaps, status and risks
• Passionate about technology with an interest in the latest trends in DevOps/SRE/Exchange engineering
• Comfort working in a rapidly evolving environment and managing through ambiguity.
• Ability to interface with cross-functional teams internally and externally
• Desire to continuously learn and improve individual competencies as well as team

title: Trading Systems Engineer
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.



Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

Working with our team of core trading systems developers to improve and expand the functionality of our matching engine, order entry mechanisms, and market data publication. We design, develop, deploy, and support real-time systems for our digital asset trading platform. Time is measured in microseconds and we aim to start measuring in nanoseconds. Reliability, fault tolerance, recoverability, throughput, and latency are what we look for in our systems. If something on the spaceship is broken we aim to fix it, if something can be automated we automate it, and we ship our code weekly.
• Use engineering principles to identify and measure risk and to implement quantitative and technical risk management solutions in software
• Understand business needs, facilitate and develop process workflows, data requirements, and specifications required to support implementation of our real time exchange
• Develop scalable architecture for future state of our exchange and contribute towards improving the trading infrastructure.
• Write robust code and APIs to support the company’s vital business
• Keep everyone informed about the health and viability of the platform by reporting known issues and status of ongoing investigations.
• Identify and advocate for changes vital to the stability and supportability of the system.
• Mentor and advise teammates to ensure new features are efficient, highly available, and fault tolerant.
• Provide continuity and stability to the production environment.
• Provide quick response to production issues to help eliminate down time thereby ensuring high availability and performance of our trading platform.
• Coordinate, prioritize and plan the changes to our trading software thereby ensuring smooth exchange migrations, quick time to market for new features and software.
• 3+ years working with FIX or other market data/order protocols

summary: Experience working with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and/or blockchain technology a huge plus. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital...
title: Software Engineer
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and others) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

Gemini is regulated and licensed like a bank, but it’s run like a tech startup, and engineering is the core of the company. There’s a wide range of tough problems to solve at Gemini – from properly securing hundreds of millions of dollars worth of customer funds, to developing innovative new blockchain products, to finding new techniques to combat fraud, to shaving microseconds off our API response times, and everything in between.

All of Gemini’s engineers are able to work across the software platform, not just on their own specialization or sub team. We value a thoughtful, collaborative software development process, coupled with a pragmatic approach to problem solving and delivering software.

As an engineer on our backend team, you’ll architect and solve complex problems that will directly influence the direction of the digital asset space. There’s a wide range of problems to solve at Gemini – from properly securing millions of dollars worth of customer funds, to developing innovative new blockchain products, to shaving microseconds off our API response times. We have a strong culture of code reviews a focus on security, with the end goal of writing and shipping high-quality code by getting things right the first time. We want to continue building the best product we can as we scale and grow our business. If you get excited about solving technical challenges that directly impact our clients, our institutional investors, and the rest of the Gemini team, we’d love to hear from you.
• Develop new products and features across all aspects of our business - financial exchange, customer accounts ledger, blockchain operations, our website, internal admin. tools, API automation access, anti-money laundering (AML), know-your-customer (KYC) compliance and many others.
• Craft automated tests and work with our QA team to ensure the operation and correctness of new product features.
• Provide technical input and knowledge to the planning, design, and requirements process for new products and features.
• Collaborate with other engineers to review code.
• Drive architecture for complex products by determining current limitations and coming up with solutions.
• Improve the performance, maintainability, and operations of the Gemini code base by engaging in occasional refactoring and upgrade projects.
• Advanced proficiency in at least one language. use mostly Scala on our backend and Javascript on the frontend – and it’s great if you’re comfortable in those, we aren’t picky as long as you’re willing to learn. We’ve had Java, C#, JavaScript, Haskell, Ruby, and Python coders pick up the new language.
• Significant experience working as an engineer, with demonstrated ability to solve performance and scale challenges.
• A proven background designing data-driven software, following observability, testing and deployment best practices.
• Experience keeping track of your work using project tracking tools like GitHub, JIRA and Confluence.
• Participating in reviewing code, helping evaluate implementations, and providing feedback about potential improvements.
• Work experience or knowledge of the finance industry, trading and/or exchange systems
• A desire to build systems to help your fellow engineers deliver their software to production more quickly and reliably
• The ability to self-organize and clearly communicate intent
• Ability to contribute throughout all phases of a service lifecycle, from conception through design, development, deployment and ultimately operation
• Work with teams to improve tooling, processes, and the software they support



It Pays to Work Here

text:
• Strong back-end development experience using one of GO, Rust or Java

• Being able to explain consensus algorithms like Raft or Paxos, PBFT

• Thrives in chaos and is comfortable with the uncertainty and the rapid change of R&D projects

• Knowledge in advanced cryptography a big plus such as group signature, zero knowledge proofs

Kaleido is a rapidly growing start-up aiming to make blockchain radically simple for organizations to adopt so that our societies will fully benefit from decentralized models and technologies. Kaleido, A ConsenSys Business, has partnered with Amazon Web Services to offer it's Blockchain Business Cloud -- the first all-in-one SaaS platform built for Enterprise Blockchain. It dramatically accelerates and simplifies private blockchain network creation and operation with click-button simplicity saving organizations months and millions in the process.Kaleido is set apart by its collaborative culture focused on putting people first and that's manifested in how we interact with each other, how we build products and solutions, and how we deliver them to our customers.We move fast, put real product in customers' hands, and iterate and learn as we move towards scale. This will allow you to make an immediate, high impact within a dedicated, and nimble team.Blockchain is a rapidly developing technology and we're excited to be one of the first pioneers in the field. Our team comes with deep technical experience and a dedication to our mission, but we still like to have fun and take full advantage of our startup environment by playing ping pong and foosball during breaks, enjoying a beer from the tap after work, team outings and more. Our team, based in urban startup hub Raleigh, NC., is continually growing and looking for more like-minded individuals. Find out more at https://kaleido.io ( https://kaleido.io )Kaleido is incubated by ConsenSys, a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. ConsenSys was started by co-founder of Ethereum Joseph Lubin, with over 50 projects and 1,000+ members around the world. The ConsenSys mission is to use the decentralized solutions from its projects to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.We're looking for a Protocol Engineer - to join our agile development team focused on the deep blockchain layer. As active participants in the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance (EEA) and contributors to multiple open source projects (Quorum, Hyperledger Fabric), our protocol team is at the forefront of Enterprise adoption of blockchain technology. In addition to solving the challenge of running and scaling permissioned blockchain networks in mission-critical Enterprise use cases, this role is also working with open source communities around data privacy, cross-chain interoperability, using technique such as zero knowledge proofs and state channels. Blockchain is a rapidly evolving technology area that has attracted a lot of brilliant minds around the world both in academia and industry. This role will be on the bleeding edge of this exciting movement.A successful candidate will have opportunities to research and develop innovative approaches to some of the most challenging problems in software such as advanced cryptography and distributed systems.NICE TO HAVEKaleido is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and deeply values diversity. We strive to create an inclusive environment for the diverse cultures, perspectives, and experiences in our workforce.

title: Lead Curriculum Architect (FinTech)
text:
• Someone with at least 5-10+ years of industry experience in the financial technology sector. We're ideally looking for someone who has worked both in large organizations environments and in smaller startups.
• Someone with a lot of hands-on experience. We're building a program in which students learn by doing! At a minimum, you should have a strong familiarity with tools like:
• Someone who absolutely loves teaching and sharing knowledge with others. It's ideal if you've taught financial technology or programming in the past. Major plus if you've spoken at fintech conferences.
• Someone with a creative itch! This program will require a great deal of ingenuity and setup to create at scale. We want someone who is excited by the idea of creating KYC applications in blockchain or machine learning powered trading algorithms.
• Someone who is a lot of fun! We want learning technology to be exciting, engaging, and a little funny. Imagine an engineering class that feels like a Disney movie. We need fun people to make this a reality.
• Someone who can manage a team. We've got a team of brilliant curriculum developers who can build amazing modules. We want someone who can bring expertise and new vision to the program. We're looking for a true tech titan.
• Someone who isn't afraid to get their hands dirty. In this capacity, you'll be responsible for keeping a living curriculum up-to-date for hundreds of Instructors and TAs across the country. This means managing issues, pull requests, and bug fixes. It also means taking in community input on technology trends. We need someone with a bit of thick skin, an infectious enthusiasm for continual improvement, and an ability to maintain a community of professionals.
• Someone who is looking for more than just a paycheck. We can't stress this enough. Deep within all of us at Trilogy is the belief that our programs change lives. Each month we hear from countless students attesting to how our program brought them new skills, landed them new jobs, and a renewed sense of confidence. This impact is what our work is really about to us.
• You will be responsible for leading a team of curriculum developers developing our FinTech program. This curriculum is one that is taught across the country by all of the Instructors and TAs in our network.
• You will be responsible for dreaming up and creating instructional activities for demonstrating key concepts in the area of financial technology.
• You will be responsible for improving portions of our curriculum based on student learning data -- and continually asked to create improved content for teaching topics covered in our program.
• You will be responsible for staying abreast of technology trends and incorporate these trends into the curriculum.
• Lastly and most importantly, you will be responsible for making sure our program is the very best financial technology training program it can be. We want the person in this role to feel accountable to our students' success in the same way we hold ourselves accountable to their success in all other areas.

Are you a passionate FinTech Professional with a knack for changing lives? Do you love writing, teaching, and storytelling as much as you love writing Python code? Are you a Blockchain wizard who loves discussing the latest trends in the field? Then we may have the position for you.At Trilogy Education Services, we're creating programs to train new audiences for careers in the tech industry. Our programs are taught at the leading universities across the country including the University of Pennsylvania, University of California Berkeley, Northwestern, UNC Chapel Hill, Rutgers, UT Austin, and many others. We pride ourselves on building high-quality programs that help ambitious, hardworking adults change their lives through practical skills, fundamental knowledge, and the confidence to advance their careers.We're looking for a top-notch FinTech professional with a love for teaching, inspiring, and helping newcomers enter the field of financial technology. The program we're developing combines theoretical teaching with plenty of hands-on practical, skills-based training.Trilogy Education Services ( http://www.trilogyed.com/ ) is a Workforce Accelerator whose mission is to empower universities to transform the lives of students by preparing them for high-growth careers in the Digital Economy. We create and manage skills-based training programs that are university-run, student-tested, and employer-approved. Each Trilogy program is individually designed to meet the needs of regional employers, and to ensure that students graduate with both technical skills and personal confidence to succeed in their careers. The world's leading universities, including Northwestern School of Professional Studies, UC Berkeley Extension, and Rutgers Division of Continuing Studies, trust Trilogy to help their students meet the needs of the Digital Economy.We're a rapidly growing and established education company with thousands of students enrolled in our programs. We're data-driven -- with a startup like culture and tremendous opportunities to have a huge impact.Oh. And we're a ridiculously fun place to work.

summary: Work with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrency and cryptographic protocols and implementations. Commonwealth Crypto is one of the top venture-backed...
title: Backend Developer
text:
Commonwealth Crypto is one of the top venture-backed blockchain startups in Boston. We’re building a critical infrastructure layer for one of the fastest growing industries in the global innovation economy and we’re looking for an excellent developer who is ready to dive into the exciting blockchain ecosystem!

Our vision is to create the most secure standard of “trustless” exchange - two parties trading without having to trust each other or a third-party (who can be negligent or dishonest). What ‘Norton Secured’ did for ecommerce, we’re doing for crypto trading.

Our product allows traders to maintain custody their digital assets even while trading at a cryptocurrency exchange. Our tech ensures that no one, even a compromised or hacked exchange, has the power to take custody of a trader’s digital assets.

Our opportunity is to work on leading edge of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrency technology, bringing to market new ideas and products that were previously conceived only in a research lab, and establishing CwC as a leader in the space. Our team is incredibly motivated by this and we’re looking for a person who will join and add to that excitement.

Our culture is focused on our employees’ professional growth and development. We encourage and welcome diverse perspectives, lifelong learners, and challengers of the status quo. We aim to be transparent, inclusive, and supportive. Like any successful startup, we evaluate thoughtfully, and execute quickly. We are a "flat" team where everyone's opinion counts. We take pride in our work and our teammates.

About the role: As a backend engineer on our team, You'll be writing the application code for our secure cryptocurrency trading protocols. But this job is NOT just about writing code! You work with our core engineering team to deeply understand and contribute to the design of our secure cryptocurrency trading protocols.



You'll be doing C# development on Linux in AWS, and work with blockchain, networking, security, and storage solutions. Specifically, you will:
• Work with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrency and cryptographic protocols and implementations
• Work with our founders and core team to design and improve our secure protocols for cryptocurrency trading
• Implement our secure trading protocols and APIs in C# on Linux in AWS.
• Use, integrate and contribute to a variety of open-source blockchain implementations
• Collaborate with our DevOps team to contribute to our world-class secure cloud deployment

We have years of experience training secure protocol, blockchain and crypto developers from the ground up, so we value applications from excellent engineers who want to make the transition into the blockchain/cryptocurrency space.
• Ability to prioritize, take responsibility for and deliver clean code
• Desire to learn about and work with cryptography, blockchain and security protocols
• You are sharp enough to understand the finer points of cryptography, blockchain and protocol design.
• You can think through all the steps required to develop component of secure code, and won't need us to hold your hand
• You have a background in cryptography, blockchain or fintech
• You have contributed to the development of blockchain or cryptography projects
• You have experience with C#
• You trade or own any digital assets.
• You have experience in fintech or capital markets.
• Our team is highly technical, motivated and bright. There is no better place to learn and geek out on blockchain and security
• You will play a key role in shaping the design and architecture of our platform
• Our company culture is built around the technical development of our engineers.
• You gain expertise in cryptography, cryptocurrency and secure cloud deployment from experts in the field.

We work out of a beautiful office in the heart of downtown Boston, in close proximity to our lead VC and other fintech startups, as well as a ton of interesting cafes and restaurants.

We offer competitive salary, benefits, and stock option plan, commensurate with experience.

About ConsenSysConsenSys is a venture production studio passionate about building and scaling tools and enterprise software products powered by Ethereum. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, security, infrastructure, and more. If you are someone that thrives in an exciting environment where being disciplined, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.The Protocol Engineering Group (PegaSys) team within ConsenSys creates and contributes to the software which operates Ethereum networks from the public chain to enterprise ecosystems. PegaSys is on a mission to enable the decentralized future by building a next-generation enterprise-grade blockchain platform.We are set to grow the ecosystem around blockchain and technologies through products that drive enterprise adoption. This work spans all layers of the (Enterprise) Ethereum protocol stack: block processing, networking, storage, and cryptography. Some of the challenges we have been focusing on include security, scalability, performance and robustness.Our path to success lies in interactions and open source contributions coming from our engagement with ConsenSys Enterprise, academic, EEA, and Ethereum Foundation communities. Some of our notable engagements include our work in Dubai as City Blockchain Advisor, Swarm storage community, and EEA vision. Current ground-level activities revolve around re-architecture of blockchain clients like Geth and Quorum into modular, pluggable, and service-oriented components.----------------------------------------------

• Working collaboratively with other Product Managers within PegaSys and the broader Mesh to provide world class product management expertise across our business

If you're someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.The Protocol Engineering Group (PegaSys) team within ConsenSys creates and contributes to the software which operates Ethereum networks from the public chain to enterprise ecosystems. We have four open roles, and the successful candidates will work with our engineering teams to define and develop product strategies and roadmaps that drive us to meet our ambitious product goals. The Product Managers will partner with internal and external parties to develop and prioritize high potential product opportunities. The products will be low-level and highly technical.You will have a strong bias toward action, will be comfortable with ambiguity in a rapidly evolving market, and will be excited to understand customer needs. The ideal candidate will also have experience collaborating with ambitious, low-level engineering teams and successfully bringing new products to market. You will also have:

title: Product Manager
text:
• Jumped on a call with key partners to understand their needs and strategic plans.
• Made tough priority calls and trade-offs balancing available time, talent, and critical business needs.
• Planned product directly with partners that are founders of $1B+ startups in the space.
• Sat down with leadership teams deploying smart contracts that are capturing $1M+ in daily active value.
• Evaluated the flows of our partners looking to optimize conversion funnels for 50k+ new users per month.
• Collaborated with engineering leads to set up your teams for success in executing on the roadmap.
• Had a finger on the pulse of your team and initiatives through regular check-ins.
• Attended a community meetup to learn and support the ecosystem and build relationships with the teams contributing to the ecosystems progression.
• Got your hands dirty with data sources in-house and third party providers to predict the leaks in our offerings, and catch trends before they surface to our partners and their users.
• Met with operational leads to establish and maintain strong communication channels essential for running the overall business.
• Interacted with partners to evangelize our product.
• Built and shipped an internal MVP that you think will be part of this ecosystems future.
• Reviewed and published metrics for your product.
• Read a tweet from a satisfied client about a feature that you put into production.
• Experience as a product manager and in the crypto space.
• Strong knowledge of Bitcoin, Ethereum (e.g., ERC-20, ERC-721), and other protocols.
• Exceptional ability to research, execute, educate, and discuss with partners
• Ability to communicate and align resources across multiple teams.
• Get a true stake in the company
• Health, dental, and vision benefits for you and your family
• Unlimited paid time off to relax and recharge
• Option to take pay in digital currencies

Wyre is the leading infrastructure provider in crypto. After trading over $3.5 billion in cryptocurrency assets and completing over $750 million in bank-to-bank FX payments, we have an established network of relationships with leading banks and exchanges. Using Wyre's API, customers are able to instantly convert fiat to crypto globally in over 50 countries, in 8 different fiat currencies, and over cryptocurrencies. We focus on compliance, licensing, and regulatory aspects so our partners can do what they do best, creating amazing tools on the blockchain.Our APIs have been helping leading brokerage services, exchanges, institutions, banks, and traditional fintech teams (remittance/payroll/savings) looking to add crypto. We power $1B+ of transfers, and maintain a perfect track record for security. If you are obsessed with the ecosystem, and excited to be working with the top tier platforms of the ecosystem, then we will put you in a position to accomplish the best work that the industry has seen to date.Product is the hot seat, and especially in a market that evolves as rapidly as crypto. You bring your thirst for changing the world, and together we'll make sure that it's delivered to millions. We're looking for someone who backs themselves and articulates their hypotheses for the future of product at Wyre, and the crypto ecosystem at large.We're excited to have you join us on this adventure.BenefitsAbout WyreEstablished in 2013, Wyre has put its stamp on the fintech world. We've grown our expertise in crypto wallets, virtual bank accounts, cross-border money transfer, and corporate payments, and we're using that knowledge now to help other crypto projects grow by providing the infrastructure.Our mission is to help crypto projects interact with the fiat world. Wyre's API provides onramps and offramps, foreign exchange, and crypto liquidity to users of various crypto projects including decentralized exchanges.Come #buidl with us!We're headquartered in San Francisco's vibrant Mission district.How We WorkWe're a group of good and honest people with good intentions to build something meaningful in a very complex and sometimes unknown industry.Personal interaction, in particular, is something we emphasize a lot. We've spent the past few years building a family and strive hard to find people who make others want to be around them. We love to be around happy people. We're extremely transparent internally and love to build relationships with our partners.We are self-driven. We are passionate. We are team players. We are family. We are Wyre.

title: Experienced Cryptocurrency Community Manager
text:
About this Job

 Crowdcreate is the #1 community management and growth agency in the cryptocurrency and tech world. We’re consistently ranked as one of the best crypto marketing agencies throughout the web. We’ve been featured on Medium.com, GoodFirms.co, and named as one of IndieGoGo’s top partner agencies. Our team has worked on over 40+ startup projects and have years of crowdfunding expertise in working with some of the largest blockchain and enterprises companies in the world. We’re connected to the most influential people in Blockchain.

 We travel to the largest crypto conferences in the world and have networked with thought leaders like the Founder of Litecoin (Charlie Lee), Co-Founder of Ethereum (Joseph Lubin) and the biggest Bitcoin Whale VC Investor (Tim Draper). Click on our team page to see us in action.We connect our clients with over 100 channels across 15 countries in 8 languages. We have attributed more than 2.57 billion views and can provide geo-specific targeting. We are based in Downtown Los Angeles, with an option to work from home.

Manage and moderate client communities which includes: Learning about the project, finding out their history, and discovering their message. Help recruit more moderators online from active communities and participant pools. Clearly and promptly respond to queries, questions, and concerns from participants and potential participants. Introduce and network new users. Host and seed discussions in our communities and our Discord room. Create an active community based on crowd creating products.



An Employee We are Expecting:

Prior blockchain experience

 A fluent level of English (fluency in other languages is a big plus, especially Russian, Korean, Chinese) Past history with blockchain technology whether it’s research, trading, etc. Understanding of ICOs, TGE, and ITOs.

 History or knowledge of community moderation and building, especially in the crypto space.

 Trustworthy and able to work with integrity remotely.

 A ‘hands-on’ approach, desire to take initiative & set your own goals to maximize results



Compensation:

 

 Experience and learn the how-tos of a blossoming industry from the comfort of your home. First dibs on getting hired on our Development Help and Engagement Team after the trial period, a stable position. A stellar recommendation from the Crowdcreate Team. Compensation depends on experience and will most likely be an hourly rate or stipend.

 About Crowdcreate

 

 Crowdcreate is a top-ranked global ICO and crowdfunding growth marketing agency based in Los Angeles, California. We've help many top 100 crypto projects grow an organic community of investors and members raising over $98 million across 50+ projects since 2014. Crowdcreate operates one of the largest network of crypto YouTube, Twitter influencers, and passionate crypto enthusiasts in all major languages, timezones, and countries. We understand the algorithm for virality and can help you trend to the top of the ICO charts. The numbers don’t lie. 81% of investors turn to social signals such as influencers, buzz and community management to make decisions. 74% of average investors trust social media influencers to inform them on good projects. With Crowdcreate, you’ll be able to unlock new audiences and build credibility for your ICO.

title: Blockchain Consulting
text:
The mission of the Crowe Blockchain practice is to develop proprietary applications that enable our clients to transform existing businesses and establish new service offerings. Crowe is seeking a Blockchain consultant (Manager) to become an integral part of this burgeoning practice. In this newly established role, the Consultant will provide technical leadership throughout the project life cycle, from ideation to application development. • This position may require overnight travel to client sites, which at times can be up to 80%.

Your Journey at Crowe Starts Here:

At Crowe Horwath LLP, you have the opportunity to deliver creative solutions to today’s complex business issues. Crowe’s accounting, consulting, and technology personnel are recognized for their expertise and understanding of process frameworks and enabling technologies, along with their dedication to delivering measurable results that help clients build business value. Our focus on emerging technology solutions along with our dedication to career growth and exceptional client value has resulted in a firm that is routinely recognized as a “Best Place to Work.” We are 75 years strong and still growing. Come grow with us!
• 5 to 7+ years of consulting experience (client-facing) with experience in either financial services, healthcare, manufacturing, supply chain, and/or operations management.

• Experience in IT assurance or internal audit is beneficial

• Experience with planning and scoping projects, creating detailed estimates, and assistance with proposal writing

Educational background in one or more of these areas:



The above statements are intended to describe the essential job functions and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties performed by personnel occupying this position.

Firmwide (FW): Firmwide is comprised of the Office of the CEO and COO. The OCEO is responsible for developing strategies and implementing plans approved by the Executive Committee. In addition, the Office of the CEO ensures counseling, leadership, support, advice and assistance as necessary to all partners and firm administrators.

At Crowe, we know that great people is what makes a great firm. We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package.

Learn more about what working at Crowe can mean for you.

How You Can Grow:

We will cultivate your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have the chance to meet on a consistent basis with your Career Coach who will guide you in your career goals and aspirations.

Learn more about where talent can prosper.

Crowe (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe uses its deep industry expertise to provide audit services to public and private entities while also helping clients reach their goals with tax, advisory, risk and performance services. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. The network consists of more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world.

title: Distributed Application Consultant
text:
. 



 Job Summary:

 As part of the Tax Emerging Technology Lab and Global Blockchain Lab, you will have the opportunity to solve technical problems and provide innovative solutions to build and support client systems, applications on distributed infrastructure platforms like Blockchain. 



 Essential Functions of the Job:

 Design and develop applications in different blockchain platforms such as Hyperledger, Ethereum, Bitcoin and other distributed computing environments. 



 Development Responsibilities:

 Learn how to design and develop in the emerging space of distributing computing applications. 

Keep up to date on emerging capabilities in this fast-growing area and identify where and how new capabilities can be applied. 

Translate requirements from architects and product managers into functional code. 

Think through and anticipate how hackers and others may attempt to subvert or misuse applications. 

Contribute to EY’s internal knowledge base on best practices in this emerging technology area. 



 Knowledge and Skills Requirements:

 2-6 years of experience in application development, preferably on immature platforms and with emerging technologies. 

Expertise in public key cryptography, Zero Knowledge Proofs, and other advanced cryptographic concepts 

Demonstrable knowledge and experience with JavaScript development, including either (though ideally both); 

Express and Node 

React and/or Angular 

Demonstrable knowledge and experience with testing frameworks such as Mocha or Jasmine. 

Demonstrable knowledge and experience with database technologies such as NoSQL and SQL. 

Previous development experience in Agile teams, ideally with knowledge of TDD environments which are remotely led. 

Interest in Blockchain and associated concepts such as smart contracts. 

Previous experience with Ethereum (including Solidity), Hyperledger and/or Bitcoin highly desirable but not essential. 

Previous experience in Go, Python or Bash shell scripting is desirable but not essential.

title: Senior Systems Software Engineer
text:
Here at BitMED we appreciate transparency and creativity. So, let’s try something new. We would like to give you the opportunity to learn more about this role the same way we would get to know you. An application!

Why is this position crucial to BitMED?

Our lean team is ready to grow! We are rapidly onboarding 22M members to our platform and that number is growing everyday. Our Senior Systems Software Engineer will be responsible for defining and implementing our software standards as they integrate between frontend, backend, data storage, infrastructure and other core system components. By joining our small team, they will be an integral contributor in developing our engineering culture. This person will be a key enabler for lean integration, faster innovation, rapid development, streamlined communication and improved collaboration.

Why does this person want to work at BitMED?

They are excited about bringing blockchain technology to the healthcare community at scale. Joining BitMED is a strategic and advantageous career move for them as they will play a crucial role as a contributor to bringing a global, no-cost healthcare solution to market. They visualize the impact they’ll have in this role and are prepared to offer their expertise towards building a successful new platform that will change the way the world views healthcare.

What will this person do on a day-to-day basis?

The Senior Systems Software Engineer will be responsible for designing and implementing software for a variety of scalable, reliable, and secure distributed computing systems (e.g. blockchain). They will design, implement, and debug core components of internal distributed computing services. They will research and implement key technologies (e.g. blockchain), architectures, and standards. They will work with other engineering teams to ensure that services meet scalability, availability, security, and performance goals.

What is this person expected to accomplish within their first 90 days?

This person will assess the status of our current system software and build upon them. They will work with various members of the engineering team to define and implement API standards. During their first 90 days, our Senior Systems Software Engineer will design and implement Protocol APIs for BitMED’s core services and work with various internal and external technical teams on the adoption. By the end of their first 90 days, we expect this person to draft the Protocol API documentation geared towards open-sourcing the API.

What qualities should this person have?

BitMED is looking for a person with the willingness to learn and the ability to contribute right off the bat. They can balance timeliness and business priorities with technical feasibility. They are adamant about solving problems and are a reliable resource for insight and assessment of technical issues. They are able to speak openly and humbly about their failures and mistakes, clearly articulating what happened and how it was addressed. They are passionate about learning, executing and leading by example. They are an open source enthusiast and a best in class developer with a desire to gain knowledge in an emerging market. They are able to think through and anticipate how hackers and others may attempt to subvert or misuse applications.

summary: 2+ years experience in peer-to-peer protocol development, familiarity with the ethereum blockchain. We're looking for a talented full-time distributed systems...
title: Director of DevOps / Distributed Systems Engineer
text:
We're looking for a talented full-time distributed systems engineer to join our team.



 Large distributed systems, usually have to track changes in cluster topology, in response to network partitions, failures, and scaling events. Various protocols exist to ensure that this can happen, with varying levels of consistency and complexity. This needs to be dynamic and real time because nodes come and go in elastic systems, failures need to be detected quickly, and load and state needs to be rebalanced in real time.



 At each layer, you should be confident in your understanding and ability to debug problems at a packet or frame level:
• File descriptors (on *nix) and buffers used for connections, NAT tables, conntrack tables etc.
• HTTP/1.1 or more recently 2.0 used extensively by gRPC.
• 2+ years experience in peer-to-peer protocol development, familiarity with the ethereum blockchain
• Ability to build and maintain highly available infrastructure
• Knowledge of peer-to-peer distributed system design and implementation, with practical knowledge in a production setting Recent history of contribution to open-source projects with Github or other repositories
• Opportunity to grow with the company
• Have your work recognized across the world
